settings.title: Frequently asked questions
settings.description: Answers to the questions we hear most from prospective clients.

settings.question: How are your fees structured?
settings.answer: We charge a transparent flat fee based on the complexity of your financial situation and the tier you choose. We do not earn commissions, accept referral fees, or receive any third-party compensation. You always know exactly what you are paying.

settings.question: What is your minimum to become a client?
settings.answer: Our Essentials tier is available to clients with $250,000 or more in investable assets. For clients with more complex needs, our Growth and Legacy tiers provide deeper planning and dedicated advisor access.

settings.question: How often will we meet?
settings.answer: All clients receive quarterly portfolio reviews and an annual comprehensive plan update. Legacy tier clients also receive semi-annual family meetings and on-demand access to their dedicated advisor.

settings.question: What does fiduciary mean?
settings.answer: A fiduciary is legally obligated to act in your best interest at all times. Unlike broker-dealers who follow a suitability standard, we must put your interests ahead of our own in every recommendation we make.

settings.question: Will I have access to my accounts?
settings.answer: Absolutely. Your assets remain in your name at an independent custodian. You have full visibility and access to your accounts at all times through the custodian's online portal and mobile app.

settings.question: How do I get started?
settings.answer: Schedule a complimentary consultation through our contact page. We will discuss your goals, answer your questions, and determine if Meridian is the right fit. There is no obligation and no pressure.
